definition: will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)

sentences.english: If tired, smell a whiff of clove oil and it will wake you up.
sentences.chinese: 如果疲倦，聞上一點丁香油將令人清醒。

sentences.english: This will give Yahoo direct and indirect ownership of 37 per cent of Alibaba.com.
sentences.chinese: 此舉將令雅虎直接和間接持有阿里巴巴37%的股權。

sentences.english: A few drops of morphia will knock him out.
sentences.chinese: 幾滴的嗎啡將令他如癡如醉。

sentences.english: Astronaut Jing Haipeng said China is ready to impress the world.
sentences.chinese: 宇航員景海鵬說，中國將令世界矚目。

sentences.english: I had orders from the director general to take this city.
sentences.chinese: 吾奉軍師將令，已取城了。

sentences.english: It features rhymed patter, which will have the audience rolling on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 它具有押韻模式，這將令觀衆滾動在地板上。

sentences.english: LUPIT will continue to weaken due to dry air intrusion.
sentences.chinese: 乾空氣的入侵將令盧碧繼續減弱。

sentences.english: It will make you the breakdown-cool cool.
sentences.chinese: 它將令您的各種資料分門別類，清清爽爽。

sentences.english: From your kind we will take our toll, for it must be done.
sentences.chinese: 吾等將令汝之種付償代價，情非得已。

sentences.english: Politicos are dithering over a deal that will bring India in from the nuclear cold.
sentences.chinese: 政客在一個將令印度擺脫核寒冬的協議上猶豫不決。

sentences.english: A pullout by Google would strip Chinese Internet users of a good alternative, the executive said.
sentences.chinese: 谷歌的離開將令中國網民失去了一個好的選擇。

sentences.english: Taking a look at how we live our lives can be be refreshing.
sentences.chinese: 看看是怎樣生活的將令你精神一振。

definition: to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
to cut prices/to discount/to mark down/price cutting
to adjust downwards/to lower (prices, wages etc)
to demote/to pass down to a lower unit
to slow/to slow down (the pace of)
expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
